title: Chinese Government awards 35 scholarships to STP students in 2018 (linked to project ID#55648)
description: On August 21st, 2018, a farewell reception was held for the 35 international students from Sao Tome and Principe who received the Chinese Government Scholarship in 2018. 35 students received the Chinese Government Scholarship to study abroad in China and further cooperation between STP and China. Students were expected to use their education to further development in STP after the completion of their studies.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government awards 35 scholarships to STP students in 2018 (linked to project ID#55648)

# Description
On August 21st, 2018, a farewell reception was held for the 35 international students from Sao Tome and Principe who received the Chinese Government Scholarship in 2018. 35 students received the Chinese Government Scholarship to study abroad in China and further cooperation between STP and China. Students were expected to use their education to further development in STP after the completion of their studies.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and human capital development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 35 scholarships for international students, focus on education and development cooperation

title: Chinese Ministry of Commerce in Sao Tome and Principe donate various goods to primary schools
description: On June 1st, 2018, the Chamber of Commerce in Sao Tome and Principe gifted items such as footballs and food to four primary schools in Sao Tome and Principe. These gifts were received by the Ministry of Education in Sao Tome and Principe. The primary schools included Gomes Primary School, the July 12th Primary School in the Agua Grande Region, the Ototo Primary School in the Mé-Zóchi Region, and the Maranza Kindergarten in the Caue Region. The gift was organized through an event held previously on May 29th, 2018.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Ministry of Commerce in Sao Tome and Principe donate various goods to primary schools

# Description
On June 1st, 2018, the Chamber of Commerce in Sao Tome and Principe gifted items such as footballs and food to four primary schools in Sao Tome and Principe. These gifts were received by the Ministry of Education in Sao Tome and Principe. The primary schools included Gomes Primary School, the July 12th Primary School in the Agua Grande Region, the Ototo Primary School in the Mé-Zóchi Region, and the Maranza Kindergarten in the Caue Region. The gift was organized through an event held previously on May 29th, 2018.
justification: Project involves donation of goods to primary schools with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of footballs and food to primary schools, organized through Ministry of Education

title: China donates 955,845 million dobras to Sao Tome and Principe for unspecified projects in 2018
description: According to Sao Tome and Principe's Ministry of Finance, Planning, and Blue Economy, the Chinese Government donated 955,845 million dobras for unspecified Sao Tome and Principe projects in 2018. The grant amount is listed as a lump sum in Sao Tome's statement of income in 2018.

According to Sao Tome and Principe's Ministry of Finance, Planning, and Blue Economy, the Chinese Government donated 955,845 million dobras for unspecified Sao Tome and Principe projects in 2018. The grant amount is listed as a lump sum in Sao Tome's statement of income in 2018.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 300 million interest-free loan — via a February 2018 ETCA — for supply of equipment to University Center of Measurement and Analysis (CUMA)
description: On February 6, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ECTA), in which the Chinese Government committed an RMB 300 million interest-free loan to supply equipment to the University Center of Measurement and Analysis (CUMA) at the Université Cheikh Anta Diop de Dakar (UCAD). The agreement was announced during a signing ceremony between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun and Senegalese Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning Amadou Ba.
staff_comments: 1. The French project title is CUMA de l’UCAD et divers projets.2. Other agreements signed at the same time include the exchange of letters for China's donation of simultaneous translation equipment for the Economic, Social and Environmental Council (“中国向塞内加尔赠送一批同传设备的换文”) (captured via Project ID#66702); the exchange of letters of installation and access to satellite television system is more than 300 villages in Senegal (在塞内加尔三百个村落实施“万村通”项目的换文) (captured via Project ID#66560); the exchange of letters for the continuation of the support of the technical mission at the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio (Centre national hospitalier d’enfants de Diamniadio) ('继续为迪亚姆尼亚久儿童医院开展技术服务的换文') (captured via Project ID#66703).3. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes that the standard borrowing terms of an interest-free loan from MOFCOM apply (0% interest rate, 20 year maturity, and 10 year grace period).4. Some sources suggest that this project was financed with an RMB 300 million grant rather than an RMB 300 million interest-free loan. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 300 million interest-free loan — via a February 2018 ETCA — for supply of equipment to University Center of Measurement and Analysis (CUMA)

# Description
On February 6, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ECTA), in which the Chinese Government committed an RMB 300 million interest-free loan to supply equipment to the University Center of Measurement and Analysis (CUMA) at the Université Cheikh Anta Diop de Dakar (UCAD). The agreement was announced during a signing ceremony between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun and Senegalese Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning Amadou Ba.
justification: Project focuses on educational equipment supply with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Supply of equipment to university center, education sector focus

title: China finances Phase I satellite television system program in more than 300 villages in Senegal in 2018 (Linked to #57618, #88620)
description: On February 8, 2018, Senegal and China signed the exchange of letters for the installation and access to satellite television system in more than 300 villages in Senegal (在塞内加尔三百个村落实施“万村通”项目的换文). This is part of the Access to Satellite TV in Ten Thousand African Villages Project committed by the Chinese government in 2015 (#57618). The project implementer is StarTimes, which had established presence in Senegal since 2010 (#30688).   StarTimes installed TV equipment across 14 provinces and covered 300 villages in Senegal. According to a Xinhua report, this project in Senegal was completed in 2018, with  jenueAfrique reporting that broadcasts were made available on July 19, 2018. The second phase of this project can be found in project #88620.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
China finances Phase I satellite television system program in more than 300 villages in Senegal in 2018 (Linked to #57618, #88620)

# Description
On February 8, 2018, Senegal and China signed the exchange of letters for the installation and access to satellite television system in more than 300 villages in Senegal (在塞内加尔三百个村落实施“万村通”项目的换文). This is part of the Access to Satellite TV in Ten Thousand African Villages Project committed by the Chinese government in 2015 (#57618). The project implementer is StarTimes, which had established presence in Senegal since 2010 (#30688).   StarTimes installed TV equipment across 14 provinces and covered 300 villages in Senegal. According to a Xinhua report, this project in Senegal was completed in 2018, with  jenueAfrique reporting that broadcasts were made available on July 19, 2018. The second phase of this project can be found in project #88620.
justification: Project focuses on providing satellite television access to rural villages, which is a social development initiative without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Installation of satellite TV systems in 300 villages, part of broader social development program in Africa

title: Chinese Government donates simultaneous translation equipment to Senegal's Economic, Social, and Environmental Council
description: On February 8, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed an exchange of letters in which the Chinese Government committed to donating simultaneous translation equipment to the Economic, Social and Environmental Council of Senegal (“Signature d’un accord de coopération économique entre le Sénégal et la Chine”). The equipment was expected to help large-scale international-Senegalese conferences, alongside policy making conferences. The Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed the handover certificate for the equipment on June 25, 2019.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government donates simultaneous translation equipment to Senegal's Economic, Social, and Environmental Council

# Description
On February 8, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed an exchange of letters in which the Chinese Government committed to donating simultaneous translation equipment to the Economic, Social and Environmental Council of Senegal (“Signature d’un accord de coopération économique entre le Sénégal et la Chine”). The equipment was expected to help large-scale international-Senegalese conferences, alongside policy making conferences. The Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed the handover certificate for the equipment on June 25, 2019.
justification: Project involves donation of translation equipment for government and civil society use, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of simultaneous translation equipment to support government conferences and policy making

title: China exchanges letters to support the technical mission at the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio (linked to #58274)
description: On February 8, 2018, Senegal and China signed the exchange of letters for the continuation of the support of the technical mission at the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio (Centre national hospitalier d’enfants de Diamniadio) ("继续为迪亚姆尼亚久儿童医院开展技术服务的换文"). The agreement was signed between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal, Zhang Xun and Amadou Ba, the Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning of Senegal. The agreement stipulates that China will provide Senegal with technical assistance through a team of six members who will be responsible for training Senegalese technicians on how to use and maintain the facilities and equipment of the Diamniadio Children's Center.   In October 25, 2017, Senegal and China signed the implementing agreement for the expansion of the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio and provide the hospital with necessary medical facilities.  On November 15, 2018, the construction officially began and was certified as completed on December 19, 2019 (captured in #58274).
staff_comments: The French project title is Hopital des Mères de Diamniadio. The Chinese project title is 的援塞内加尔妇幼医院项目 or 关于承担援塞妇幼医院的换文. Also, note that this newly-constructed obstetrics and gynecology complex is immediately adjacent to another Chinese Government-financed medical facility in Diamniadio City (see Project ID#53218). More detailed locational information can be accessed at https://www.google.com/maps/place/Hopital+des+M%C3%A8res+de+Diamniadio/@14.7264816,-17.1621427,18z/data=!4m12!1m6!3m5!1s0x0:0x5428c065dc1b5154!2sHospital+Children+De+Diamniadio!8m2!3d14.7268344!4d-17.1636608!3m4!1s0xec1999aa8431eb9:0xb7305eac950e38b1!8m2!3d14.7281526!4d-17.1639678It is unclear the terms of the technical assistance agreement and how long the staff will be responsible for training the local Senegalese staff, however during the Covid pandemic it was reported that the technical mission was ongoing.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China exchanges letters to support the technical mission at the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio (linked to #58274)

# Description
On February 8, 2018, Senegal and China signed the exchange of letters for the continuation of the support of the technical mission at the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio (Centre national hospitalier d’enfants de Diamniadio) ("继续为迪亚姆尼亚久儿童医院开展技术服务的换文"). The agreement was signed between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal, Zhang Xun and Amadou Ba, the Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning of Senegal. The agreement stipulates that China will provide Senegal with technical assistance through a team of six members who will be responsible for training Senegalese technicians on how to use and maintain the facilities and equipment of the Diamniadio Children's Center.   In October 25, 2017, Senegal and China signed the implementing agreement for the expansion of the National Children’s Hospital Center in Diamniadio and provide the hospital with necessary medical facilities.  On November 15, 2018, the construction officially began and was certified as completed on December 19, 2019 (captured in #58274).
justification: Project focuses on healthcare infrastructure and technical assistance without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Technical mission at children's hospital, medical facilities provision, training of technicians

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 1.05 billion government concessional loan for Phase 1 of Smart Senegal Project (Linked to Project ID#92565)
description: On February 8, 2018, during a meeting between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun and Senegalese Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning Amadou Ba, the Government of Senegal and China Eximbank signed an RMB 1.05 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement and an RMB 200 million grant agreement for Phase 1 of the Smart Senegal Project. The GCL is captured via February 8, 2018. The RMB 200 million grant is captured via Project ID#92565. According to the Government of Senegal’s Aid Management Platform, the GCL disbursed in 2019 and 2020 and achieved an overall disbursement rate of 100%.   This project aims to leverage information and communication technology to reduce the digital deficit and make Senegal a sub-regional hub in West Africa, particularly in the areas of security, education, health, and tourism. The Smart Senegal Project consists of five major sub-projects: (1) Safe City: This sub-project aims to strengthen public security through the use of technological tools and processes for the collection, analysis of flows, events from various communication systems and dissemination of information; (2) Smart Education: This sub-project project aims on the one hand to modernize network, processing, and data storage infrastructures and on the other hand to deploy technological platforms to improve teaching and learning in universities, schools elementary, middle and high schools in Senegal. (3) Smart Territories: This sub-project aims to provide user-centered services (citizens, administrations, and businesses) by building a citizen’s house (“La Maison du Citoyen”) in all the country's departments; (4) Submarine Cable: The purpose of this sub-project is to land a submarine cable in Senegal allowing access to international bandwidth. This new device will increase Senegal's internet capacity and vary the Internet access offer for ISPs; and (5) Smart Wifi: The Smart Wifi sub-project project aims to fight against the digital isolation of territories by increasing the number of digital access points. It will allow citizens to access a high-speed internet connection in public places. This access will be open to all citizens and will be available on all types of terminals (smartphone, tablet, laptop, etc.). In essence, this project aims to support the digital transformation of Senegal's networks.   Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible for implementation. Project implementation began in January 2019, and in early 2021, Huawei installed an online-meeting platform for the central government of Senegal, allowing high-level officials to meet virtually amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. The digital hub portion of the project was completed on June 22, 2021 and celebrated during a ribbon-cutting ceremony attended by the Senegalese President Macky Sall and Chinese Ambassador to Senegal. At this ceremony, the Government of Senegal also announced its plans to transfer government data to the center.
staff_comments: 1. The French project title is Projet Smart Senegal. The Chinese project title is “智慧塞内加尔”项目.2. On June 22, 2021, Senegal announced it would move its government data and digital platforms to a new national data center financed by a loan of $83.3 million USD from the Export-Import Bank of China and built by Huawei, which also provided equipment and technical support. The first phase of the new center, located in the Digital Technology Park in Diamniadio, will be open in six months and will also house data from state-owned enterprises in Senegal. The announcement comes on the heels of another agreement signed between Huawei and the African Telecommunications Union (a specialized agency of the African Union), which stipulates that the Chinese company will engage at multiple levels of ICT integration and transformation with AU member states. This will likely involve skills development and training for personnel in local ICT sectors, and information exchange on the latest technological trends and expansion of rural connectivity across Africa.3. Senegal’s Ministry of Finance identifies a $150 million USD China Eximbank loan agreement for the Smart Senegal Project, which was signed on August 8, 2018. It is not clear if this represents a separate loan commitment from the RMB 1.05 billion government concessional loan agreement that was signed on February 8, 2018. This issue warrants further investigation. 4. As this project was denominated in RMB and identified as a government concessional loan from China Eximbank, AidData assumes the following borrowing terms: a maturity period of 20 years, an interest rate of 2%, and a grace period of 5 years.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER MULTISECTOR

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 1.05 billion government concessional loan for Phase 1 of Smart Senegal Project (Linked to Project ID#92565)

# Description
On February 8, 2018, during a meeting between the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun and Senegalese Minister of Economy, Finance and Planning Amadou Ba, the Government of Senegal and China Eximbank signed an RMB 1.05 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement and an RMB 200 million grant agreement for Phase 1 of the Smart Senegal Project. The GCL is captured via February 8, 2018. The RMB 200 million grant is captured via Project ID#92565. According to the Government of Senegal’s Aid Management Platform, the GCL disbursed in 2019 and 2020 and achieved an overall disbursement rate of 100%.   This project aims to leverage information and communication technology to reduce the digital deficit and make Senegal a sub-regional hub in West Africa, particularly in the areas of security, education, health, and tourism. The Smart Senegal Project consists of five major sub-projects: (1) Safe City: This sub-project aims to strengthen public security through the use of technological tools and processes for the collection, analysis of flows, events from various communication systems and dissemination of information; (2) Smart Education: This sub-project project aims on the one hand to modernize network, processing, and data storage infrastructures and on the other hand to deploy technological platforms to improve teaching and learning in universities, schools elementary, middle and high schools in Senegal. (3) Smart Territories: This sub-project aims to provide user-centered services (citizens, administrations, and businesses) by building a citizen’s house (“La Maison du Citoyen”) in all the country's departments; (4) Submarine Cable: The purpose of this sub-project is to land a submarine cable in Senegal allowing access to international bandwidth. This new device will increase Senegal's internet capacity and vary the Internet access offer for ISPs; and (5) Smart Wifi: The Smart Wifi sub-project project aims to fight against the digital isolation of territories by increasing the number of digital access points. It will allow citizens to access a high-speed internet connection in public places. This access will be open to all citizens and will be available on all types of terminals (smartphone, tablet, laptop, etc.). In essence, this project aims to support the digital transformation of Senegal's networks.   Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. is the contractor responsible for implementation. Project implementation began in January 2019, and in early 2021, Huawei installed an online-meeting platform for the central government of Senegal, allowing high-level officials to meet virtually amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. The digital hub portion of the project was completed on June 22, 2021 and celebrated during a ribbon-cutting ceremony attended by the Senegalese President Macky Sall and Chinese Ambassador to Senegal. At this ceremony, the Government of Senegal also announced its plans to transfer government data to the center.
justification: Project focuses on digital transformation and ICT infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Digital transformation focus, ICT infrastructure development, public services improvement

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Affiniam Dam Rehabilitation Project
description: On July 21, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed letters of exchange related to the Affiniam Dam Rehabilitation Project. This project was funded from the grant proceeds in an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed on November 18, 2016.    This project involved the rehabilitation of Affiniam Dam, which is located about 20 kilometers northwest of Ziguinchor. China Railway N°8 Engineering Company (CREC8) was the contractor responsible for implementation. A  groundbreaking ceremony for the project was organized on November 20, 2019 and it was originally anticipated that the project implementation period would be 7 months. However, the project was completed and handed over on September 18, 2020. According to Senegalese media - Teranga News, the project was completed at an estimated cost of 52,605,001 Yuan.   The Chinese project title is 阿菲尼亚姆水坝修缮项目. The French project title is la réhabilitation du barrage d’Affiniam. The Affiniam Anti-Salt Dam was completed in 1988 with financial support of China. It is estimated to have cost about FCFA 10 billion (approximately $21 million). Its construction allowed for the protection of about 12,000 hectares of potential rice-growing lands from salt intrusion.
staff_comments: 1. This project was coded as a MOFCOM grant as according to the document (中铁 中交 电建 能建 中冶狂揽海外订单) CREC8 was selected as the contractor after receiving foreign aid qualifications from the Ministry of Commerce.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Affiniam Dam Rehabilitation Project

# Description
On July 21, 2018, the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed letters of exchange related to the Affiniam Dam Rehabilitation Project. This project was funded from the grant proceeds in an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) the Chinese Government and the Government of Senegal signed on November 18, 2016.    This project involved the rehabilitation of Affiniam Dam, which is located about 20 kilometers northwest of Ziguinchor. China Railway N°8 Engineering Company (CREC8) was the contractor responsible for implementation. A  groundbreaking ceremony for the project was organized on November 20, 2019 and it was originally anticipated that the project implementation period would be 7 months. However, the project was completed and handed over on September 18, 2020. According to Senegalese media - Teranga News, the project was completed at an estimated cost of 52,605,001 Yuan.   The Chinese project title is 阿菲尼亚姆水坝修缮项目. The French project title is la réhabilitation du barrage d’Affiniam. The Affiniam Anti-Salt Dam was completed in 1988 with financial support of China. It is estimated to have cost about FCFA 10 billion (approximately $21 million). Its construction allowed for the protection of about 12,000 hectares of potential rice-growing lands from salt intrusion.
justification: Project focuses on dam rehabilitation for agricultural purposes without clear energy transition impact
evidence: Rehabilitation of Affiniam Dam, protection of rice-growing lands from salt intrusion, agricultural focus

title: China awards 75 Chinese Government scholarships to students in Senegal for the 2018/2019 academic year
description: According to a notice for applications posted by the Chinese Embassy in Senegal, a total of 75 scholarships were issued for the 2018/2019 academic year, with 51 for Senegalese students who will continue their studies in China and 24 for Senegalese students who will be newly admitted in 2018. On August 8, 2018 the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun awarded 27 Senegalese students with admission notices for the scholarship program.   The amount of the scholarships for each student varies based on their admitted program with scholarships totaling from 59,200 CNY for each Bachelors students and upwards of 99,800 CNY for each PhD candidates, each student has the opportunity to study in China.
staff_comments: While the Ambassador had awarded 27 students, it was noted in the application posting that only 24 scholarships will be provided for new students - it is reasonable that this allocation has either changed, or continuing students were present at the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China awards 75 Chinese Government scholarships to students in Senegal for the 2018/2019 academic year

# Description
According to a notice for applications posted by the Chinese Embassy in Senegal, a total of 75 scholarships were issued for the 2018/2019 academic year, with 51 for Senegalese students who will continue their studies in China and 24 for Senegalese students who will be newly admitted in 2018. On August 8, 2018 the Chinese Ambassador to Senegal Zhang Xun awarded 27 Senegalese students with admission notices for the scholarship program.   The amount of the scholarships for each student varies based on their admitted program with scholarships totaling from 59,200 CNY for each Bachelors students and upwards of 99,800 CNY for each PhD candidates, each student has the opportunity to study in China.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and human development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Education sector, scholarship program for Senegalese students, no energy or infrastructure components
